item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Karen add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Karen add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "I’m the frosting on America’s cake, and tonight I’m willing to let you lick the bowl." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Karen add a quote by Charles Caleb Colton
item.description: "Next to acquiring good friends, the best acquisition is that of a good book." -- Charles Caleb Colton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Karen add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Karen add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Tomorrow you're all going to wake up in a brave new world, a world where the Constitution gets trampled by an army of terrorist clones, created in a stem-cell research lab run by homosexual doctors who sterilize their instruments over burning American flags. Where tax-and-spend Democrats take all your hard-earned money and use it to buy electric cars for National Public Radio, and teach evolution to illegal immigrants. Oh, and everybody's high!" -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Karen add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Karen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Karen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Karen add a quote by Machik Labdron
item.description: "Approach what you find repulsive, help the ones you think you cannot help, and go places that scare you. " -- Machik Labdron

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Karen add a quote by Darren E. Laws
item.description: "If you are still breathing maybe it is not such a bad day after all..." -- Darren E. Laws

item.title: Karen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
item.description: "I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving - we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it - but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor." -- Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

item.title: Karen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jonas Mekas
item.description: "In the very end, civilizations perish because they listen to their politicians and not to their poets." -- Jonas Mekas

item.title: Karen add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you do follow your bliss you put yourself on a kind of track that has been there all the while, waiting for you, and the life that you ought to be living is the one you are living. Follow your bliss and don't be afraid, and doors will open where you didn't know they were going to be." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Karen add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I believe there is something out there watching us. Unfortunately, it's the government." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Karen add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Karen add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Allow the President to invade a neighboring nation, whenever he shall deem it necessary to repel an invasion and you allow him to do so whenever he may choose to say he deems it necessary for such purpose -- and you allow him to make war at pleasure. . . . If, today, he should choose to say he thinks it necessary to invade Canada to prevent the British from invading us, how could you stop him? You may say to him, 'I see no probability of the British invading us'; but he will say to you, 'Be silent; I see it, if you don't." -- Abraham Lincoln
